Reviews.Title: “Decent spot.”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be adequate for a night stay. It is quiet and clean with good size rooms. The room was well appointed with a decent size TV and big bathroom(Nice rain shower). The bed was okay but the pillows were awful(really cheap). The hotel has a bar and covered garage for $15 but most parking spots are parallel and require parking 2 cars one behind the other so if you leave at odd hours you might be boxed in. Personnel was friendly and the location was okay(you need a car to move around).

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with a friend and loved it! I really liked how modern and chic the hotel was. The biggest plus, and selling point of the hotel, was the fact that it was literally just minutes away from Universal Studios. There is a free shuttle that is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel! The staff was nice and helpful; Rooms were very clean and the beds are soo comfortable! Next time I return to LA, this will be my first choice to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “They do the small things and big things very very well”
Reviews.Author: farnie k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our second anniversary and wanted some where nice to stay. I sometimes lack that creative romantic gene so when I called the blvd and told them that we were celebrating our anniversary they provided us with something very thoughtful, meaning and lasting. When we checked in there was fruit, wine (which was okay) and a sign saying welcome. It's the small things that count - the staff were friendly, accommodating (even though one of the staff's jokes was a hit or miss at times lol) and the rooms were a lot larger then expected. The lobby had this European style/ taste which was unusual but it worked in a weird kind of way. In terms of price it was great value - I would recommend this hotel to all couples.

Reviews.Title: “um. not so much”
Reviews.Author: str8foward
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel/room. It looks nice and modern and swanky from the pictures/the lobby. Upon entering the room directly in front of the elevator :-| I was instantly displeased. I am certain the hotel rooms are furnished by Ikea. Not that there is anything wrong with Ikea, but the rooms felt very cheap and low budget. The bathroom had an old pee smell, so I hated using it. The toilet was weird, not sure if it was a handicap toilet but it was really strange. The bed did not seem as big as a normal King sized bed, the floors were cheap and peeling. The satellite cable including movie channels was the best thing about this room. We had a direct view of a concrete wall. literally. The walls are thin so you hear everything and the ac is super loud so sleep was not easy. The lighting is very low, so we had to turn on all the lights just to get the room to brighten up a little. The room was somewhat clean for the most part, but I still felt dirty in the room(if that makes sense). Overall I would not stay here again. EVER. I did not like it in the least.

Reviews.Title: “Promising”
Reviews.Author: pizzaghost
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a little after they originally opened. Booking was easy and smooth. Upon arival they told me they had lost the reservation. In the most polite way possible they explained the situation and gave me a comp upgrade for the troubles. The room was comfortable and well furnished. The price was fair and seemed fitting for the amenities and location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rates 4 stars in comfort and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: gkinaz
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and roomy with a great bath and shower. Excellent bedding. A parking fee is charged and hotel must park the car and keep keep the keys due to limited space. In all a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “They keep asking me to review them...”
Reviews.Author: rmushadisright
Reviews.Content: So here I am. I don't have much to say. I booked on their website for a 6 night stay, hit the confirm button and thought I was done. I thought it was peculiar that I didn't get a confirmation email but I did get an email from them thanking me for booking and offering me a free room upgrade when I arrived. Great! As we're getting closer to the date, I call them and tell them that I can't get their website to work. I just want to confirm my booking and it's price. They transfer me a couple times, put me on hold for almost 10 minutes and then come back and tell me they don't have any reservation under my name. I explained that I booked it through the site and that I did get other emails from them. The person on the phone offered little in the way of assistance, empathy or anything else. They just had kind of a tough luck attitude. I don't necessarily blame them. They sounded young. I just don't think they knew what to say. So I went back on the site and tried to re-book only now the price is double what it was when I originally booked it and it wasn't cheap to begin with. It felt as if they were trying to take advantage of those making last minute plans for the Oscars (it was oscar weekend). Given the hotel's sorted previous reviews, it was no longer enticing at the price we were quoted. We ended up booking with the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn less than a mile away and that was an awesome hotel. I wish they would have offered a solution for the booking error. It was clearly the fault of their website. They obviously got some information from me because I got an email on what would have been the last day of our stay, asking how we liked the hotel and then another email today again asking us to review the hotel. I didn't even step foot in the building but judging from the past reviews, I'd probably echo the sentiments that they still have some rough edges to sand down (figuratively and literally apparently). The staff is young and sounded inexperienced. To the hotel's credit, it does look really nice from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Blvd Hotel Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Snowbear007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight when we went to Universal Studios. Decor was contemporary and nice even though my husband noticed a bunch of construction defects. Still for the price it was right. The bed was most comfortable!! Free beer and wine during happy hour!! Short walk to the park shuttle. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Blvd hotel convienient and hip”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Blvd. three times since Thanksgiving for over 10 nights.The staff are informative and friendly.The hotel has great rooms and the lobby/bar are a nice place to meet. I highly recommend The Blvd and look forward to staying at their Hollywood location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST hotels we stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: khakiness
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LA with no hotel reservation. When we went to visit a friend in Hollywood, he suggested several hotels in the area. We booked this hotel for 2 nights at hotels.com. It recently opened in 2011, and the carpet smelled very fresh. The room was dimly lit (which added to the great ambiance), and it smelled like fresh linen. The King bed was one of the most comfortable beds in which we ever slept. Overall, the room was great, the property was beautiful, and the staff were very friendly. We will definitely book this hotel again when we return to LA. A+

Reviews.Title: “The BLVD for Joe Bonamassa”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_the_Shu
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the BLVD every time we catch Joe Bonamassa playing at the Baked Potato 2 blocks away. The hotel is very clean, close access to Hwy 101, and walking distance to the Baked Potato (a small club that has great performers come and play). We can enjoy the show, drink as we please, and walk back to the BLVD. We had friends also stay at the hotel - so we all met up before the show. It was waaaaaay cool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, service,location”
Reviews.Author: stephtravelwriter
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. Only open 10 months, the beds are MY BED quality and you feel like a princess sleeping in exceptional style. Rooms are HUGE, glass window/door ultra modern fridge,rainwater dump shower but the best of all is the service. The staff make you expresso cappuccino for free, the breakfast is 24 hr and they even gave me a vitamin water for free (I left my wallet in room). Exceptional personal service - best I have EVER experienced in USA (travelling from Australia). Walk to universal studios and highly efficient metro - 1 stop to Hollywood on the red line. We got a rate of $138 with tax on Internet. Incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay .....HUGE rooms super duper staff”
Reviews.Author: KIWIWORLDTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: Fantastic check in and very helpful , checked in late and staff was very helpful and attentive. Nice bar and cafe in lobby , made me feel quite at home. Great Hotel and very close to Universal City walk etc and train station. Really enjoyed my visit to Hollywood. Would highly recommend ....:)

Reviews.Title: “Niceeee”
Reviews.Author: sty56416
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with room and ammenities available, Def coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Guy's from Palm Springs!”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, great staff, hotel was still in remodel process but couldn't tell. Will stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: Ferny C
Reviews.Content: Great rates, great rooms and the staff are very welcoming. Plus, you can't beat the free drinks during happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with friendly staff, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: overgaard
Reviews.Content: After my original hotel was overbooked I was transferred to this hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel does seem to be at the infant level, it seemed as if they were still finishing it, however the quality was good. If you want to be close to Universal Studios then there is really no better hotel, however if you want to be close to the Walk of Fame and Hollywood then perhaps this hotel is not the right one for you. Since the hotel is located close to Ventura Blvd. be prepared for some traffic noise, however other than that the sleep quality was pretty ok, the beds were comfy and clean. The room was in general according to standards our room even had a small fridge, and the bathroom was nice. The staff was polite and helpful even if they did send us in the wrong direction when we asked for the nearest laundromat.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place, but...”
Reviews.Author: amoore928
Reviews.Content: This place is reasonably priced, but for good reason. I was totally prepared for the fake wood floors, dark rooms, shotty paint/construction and the poor excuse for a pool per previous reviews. But I was not prepared for the ants. We killed over 30 in the first 3 hours. They were mostly in the bathroom. On the second day there were so many in the kitchenette that we finally called down to the front desk. They said they would send someone right up. They did. Two men with a huge jug of ant killer. They sprayed all around the kitchenette and then wiped up the dead ants. They said "they shouldn't bother you anymore" and then left. No one ever apologized and no one offerered to let us switch rooms. But what good would it have done? If we had that many ants, I'm guessing all the rooms did too. We also saw some in the pool room. The PROS: Close to Universal City Walk and Universal Studios. You walk about 2 blocks and then catch a free shuttle up the hill to the fun. We stayed 2 nights for under $300. 2 nice tv's in the room - ours was a Queen suite. Great shower. Free Wi-fi that actually worked! Plenty of space to move around in the room. CONS: not very kid friendly. You have to walk all the way thru the entire parking garage to get to a room with the smallest hotel pool I've ever seen. There is no bible in the room, no book with hotel services or area attraction numbers or help in the area what-so-ever. The whole place was just cold and inpersonal. Other than the ants, it was just an ok experience. It was worth the stay because it was cheap and I managed to get free parking. I have no idea where the spa was, they gave me 3 brochures, but never said where it was. I doubt I will ever stay there again. When we checked out the very young girl behind the desk didn't ask how our stay was - I was prepared to complain more about the ants - but they obviously don't care what you think. Go ahead and book a room - but be prepared that you aren't getting much else.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, convenient place to stay for out-and-about travelers”
Reviews.Author: sjrotts
Reviews.Content: The BLVD is extremely affordable and conveniently located on Ventura Blvd. just blocks away from Universal Studios. It strives for a European-ish feel and seems to cater best to the expectations of foreign tourists. I've stayed there twice in the last two months and probably will again, as I am out and about most days during my trips to LA and all that I really require is a clean room, decent bed and a nice TV (DirecTV at the BLVD is a plus). Parking is extremely easy; no need for a valet. My hope is that by the next time the hotel will be finished. Rooms are still being renovated, painted, wired and appointed, and you may find yourself in one of them.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE ROOM, HOSTILE MANAGER, STEER CLEAR!”
Reviews.Author: melshae
Reviews.Content: The fake hardwood floors make for a very noisy night and morning due to the clickity clack of your neighbor's high heels - don't plan on getting any sleep. This place was cheaply remodeled, had zero ambient lighting. When the maid walked in on me naked, I'd had enough and called for the manager. Apparently their generic 'do not disturb' tag has 'service requested' on the opposite of it - an almost guaranteed mistake by any sleepy traveller. This shouldn't be rocket science. However the maid should have known, as they are alerted which rooms have requested late checkout - which I had. The pergo floors is also the dumbest thing I've ever seen in a hotel.The manager said "I only care what GOOD customers think' - apparently my money as a regular business traveller isn't as good as other people's? He said "This isn't the Motel 6" - just a crazy thing to say. I said if it was Motel 6 at least I would have gotten some sleep and the maid wouldn't have walked in on me. And it would have cost a quarter as much. When he refused any kind of remuneration whatsover, I told him I would review his hotel everywhere I could - he *actually* said he was going to call security on me! yes, for that exact comment, I did nothing else - this was on the phone. When I left, I took a picture of the desk with him at it - which I have a legal right to do as it is public - he charged at me and I said what, are you going to attack me now? And he said yes! Absolutely crazy man. The staff said this was the highest up man that they have access to, did not have owner's info. This manager needs to be fired and put in the looney bin. I would have called the police if I wasn't in a rush to get to my account. I later told my friends about the place and they said yes, and the service at the restaurant is all attitude and no substance.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there”
Reviews.Author: poohbear98
Reviews.Content: Here's an idea 4 cheap advertising & misrepresentation. Give out a bunch of free nt stay vouchers, then say they've expird when someone tries to use it. That's exactly the kind of practices this hotel employs. Wouldn't trust your reservation to be there or for the price you thought it would be either. Avoid and stay somewhere reputable and trustworthy.

Reviews.Title: “So good I had to review it!”
Reviews.Author: SharonCarole
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've written a review, but it was such a surprise that I felt compelled to. The staff was extremely efficient and friendly, the room was clean and very modern. It felt like we were staying in a 4 star resort. The location couldn't be beat either. I highly recommend this hotel and wish we had more time to spend here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozzy858
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights in L.A. with friends and stayed at the BLVD hotel. We selected this hotel sight/location unseen. It turned out to be a great place to stay, very close to the metro, hollywood hills, hollywood bowl and Universal studios. I cannot say enough good things about the staff, they helped us daily with directions and ideas on places to go and eat, they were very friendly and professional. The hotel itself was nice and clean with a modern decor. It was great to have a frig and microwave in our room. All in all this was a great place to stay, I know I will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: wadewords
Reviews.Content: We were told that the hotel, opened in February, was having a "soft" opening because the spa and workout room would not be open until the end of summer. With that in mind, we think it should not yet be open at all. THE PLUSES: Staff is lovely, no problem with an early check-in, great location close to Universal Studios and the Hollywood Bowl, there's in-room coffee and a refrigerator, bed linens are soft and lovely, room was clean, attractive lobby with full bar. Good neighborhood restaurants are within walking distance. THE MINUSES: There's a difference between European minimalist which is what we think this hotel is going for, and just plain stark. Smallish rooms have harsh overhead spot lights and no bedside lamps so reading in bed is almost impossible. What appears to be a laminate floor is dark, without any rugs. The thermostat on the wall is not connected to the wall a/c unit so you have to turn it on manually, and it is difficult to adjust. Direct TV was not intuitive, and there were no directions. European shower, while efficient, also was not intuitive. we had to call the desk to find out how to use it. Even though the place has been open just a few months, it's already showing signs of wear in the wall covering. Worst is parking. It's available under the building, but is so limited that if your car is the last one in a slot, you'll be stacked behind another car and will have to leave your keys at the desk so staff can move your car if needed. Beds were way too soft for us. This hotel should not be open yet. Although we were told that bedside lamps are "on the way" and that the thermostat will be fixed, we'd be reluctant to stay here again unless we were assured that all problems had been fixed. We chose this hotel because it had excellent pricing, far less than the two Universal hotels ($116 with our AAA discount vs close to $200 for nearby Universal hotels) and because it is walking distance from the friend we were visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Shady Place”
Reviews.Author: jonnyprecious
Reviews.Content: My wife booked me a room here to see as concert at Gibson Aphitheater. Upon first glance, the hotel would seem modern and smart. But after staying there, the reality is much darker. First off, if it's a hotel and spa, where is the "spa"? There was no literature about any amenity or service to be found anywhere in the lobby or in my room, which I find odd. Usually there is at least a booklet to tell a traveler where local attractions and services are located; this place had none. But this falls in line with the Spartan decor of the room. I decided to go to the lounge, where I proceeded to have to train two employees how to pour a tap beer because, as I was told numerous times, "the bartender isn't here yet," and it was 4 p.m. The employee charged me $5 for two beers and said he would refill them. When the bartender did arrive for "happy hour," we ordered another two beers, and we were charged $14 for them. Nice consistency there, fellas. When we arrived back at the hotel at 2 a.m., we wanted to get some food. We asked what was open and that we just wanted some grub. The outgoing young guy working the desk wrote down a restaurant and called a cab for us, presumably someone he knew. He assured us the first place would be open. Thirty minutes later, we arrived at this restaurant, which was closed, so the cab driver proceeded to drive us to a restaurant five minutes from the hotel, and the cab fare was $60 by the end. There was some sort of trickery afoot, I am convinced. Lastly, as I called the next morning for checkout time, no answer. I will never stay here again, and while it is close to Universal, it's a dodgy place to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - This place is not ok. See positive reviews as schills.”
Reviews.Author: mamababoo
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good shower, low price, good dresser space. Cons: Lousy service, lousy functionality of room features (tvs, phone, etc.), freeway noise, inept management, lousy housekeeping, overwhelming odors, dirty lobby entrance, garage a questionable hang-out spot. Now here’s my story: From the website and the price offering this seemed like a great idea for my ongoing visits to LA to spend time with my son. How wrong I was. Here is how it all went down: Upon arrival, seemingly odd bit of sustained "hanging out" of folks in the parking lot (ground floor below hotel), something you'd expect more in a 7-Eleven parking lot, not in a place billing itself as a hotel and spa. I'll add that this continued throughout the visit. Also the cigarette butts stubbed out in the parking lot were numerous as was evidence of fast-food garbage and spent cans of beer, here's an idea, if that many people are smoking and hanging in your parking lot maybe a trash can and ash tray might be in order. The check in process was mildly encouraging, seemingly nice front desk. The room itself was at-a-glance on par with what you might for a newly appointed hotel. Nice bathroom with a clever sink and newer bed and linens but the floors are not really wood, some kind of plastic vinyl situation and this kind of is a common thread throughout, the room, faux, it kind of looks good but isn't really. The room was also a bit dark, but there was a patio. But a patio with a spilled Starbucks plastic cup and a big chocolaty coffee stain, which was not cleaned or removed during the whole visit. Room faces freeway on ramp. I get settled and unpacked and head out with son for a day together. Back in evening, flip on TV as is my habit pre bed in hotels. Blue screen, no signal. Try other TV. Nothing. Two remotes one not working. Since I am now in my night clothes, think best to call down to the desk and explain the problem. Hotel phone not working. Give up, go to sleep. Next AM. Try TVs. Nothing. Phone still dead. Get dressed, head down the hall with heavy scent of what smelled like about a kilo of fresh cut marijuana, seriously. I'm not one to just toss that out there, but it was pungent and breaking through the overload of air freshener they use in the halls. For what it's worth, the next day I didn't smell the dopey smell again, only the air freshener and that was noxious. Anyway back to the second day after a night and morning of no TV, no phone. Go to front desk and gently explain I have some problems. Desk says this will be fixed today. Can’t fix it now because only the maid knows how to fix it (?) and she’s not here yet. I give her my son's cell and ask she call and let us know when all is fixed, so I can be reassured because my confidence is a little off kilter. Son and I head out for the day. Hotel calls, says all is fixed except the phone, phone can't be fixed. Something about needing multiple vacant rooms in order to fix the phone in this room, and by golly, they’ve been full since they opened. Do I have a cell phone or should they move me to another room? I say, “oh no need to move, I have my cell”. It's fine, I can deal with this. Back at hotel after dinner. Son and I have doubts so he comes in to check the room with me. In lobby, manager is there, seems nice. Make some small talk about the NBA Finals and then head up to the room. Try TVs. Neither works. Phone still dead. Son and I head down to see the manager. Manager says it’s a new property and that’s why he took the time to come in on the weekend. He says he knocked on the door earlier to address the problem, but we weren't there so he couldn't fix it. We try and explain we addressed it earlier and Hotel called and said they fixed it. He kept cutting us off as we tried to explain the situation. He says he’ll come up to the room and fix it. Explains on the way that people sometimes misuse the TVs and that’s why they’re hard to use. Comes into room, adjusts something on back of one TV (voila, it works!), then tries the same trick on the other. No go. Tells us that remote control for second TV has no battery, that's the problems there. Would we be ok just using the one, ok sure. And that he is sorry but these things happen, we are all human after all. And would we like for him to buy us a drink. No thanks. How about some champagne he offers. No thank you. After he leaves I prep for next morning and find the coffee pot hasn't been cleaned. Ugh, so I clean it. Son leaves and asks to speak with manager, front desk staff say he is upstairs helping a guest. Son waits, and sees manager walk in from sidewalk outside hotel. Upstairs huh? Son meets him outside and explains coffee situation and asks if that is normal for this hotel? Manager explains that no, he is sorry and happy son isn't cursing at him, and that we are nice people, and that, “maid must have lost her mind” and offers to clean the room personally. And again offers champagne and drinks. No thanks. Son asks that his mom’s room and stay be without incident forthwith, could he see to that? Yes he says, he could do that. Next two days are without much incident. We say hello and goodbye and are polite but the earlier snafus are never mentioned by staff. Never see the manager again, although he is on premises. In the comings and goings the staff just seems sheepish, incompetent, and basically clueless. Last day there, back after an evening with son. Close to bedtime for a nice 65 year old lady. Knock on door. Manager wants to give me a bottle of some kind of champagne. I respond I don’t drink champagne (I honestly don’t). Guy at door tries to get me to take it, but I tell him no till he finally leaves. Checked out the following morning. Once again, the parking lot seems to be a hangout for folks who may or may not stay at this hotel. Me, never going back. And I'm pretty forgiving when it comes to hotel stays but in this case, fellow travelers need to be warned about this place. PS: At one point the manager offered a reduction in room rate. Haven’t heard from him on that one since I left. ________________________________________ No virus found in this message.

Reviews.Title: “Not an Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ADW44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in hopes of having a relaxing few days in the LA area which we were visiting for a wedding in May. When we arrived for our stay on Thursday night there was a DJ and the lobby/lounge area was a party like environment that had spewed out into the parking lot. We were a little disturbed by the atmosphere because it was extremely loud and the walls are very thin so the sound traveled easily throughout the hotel. The parking lot is located underneath the hotel and throughout our stay we saw a lot of people hanging out in the lot which gave us an uncomfortable feeling when we were coming and going. Anyway, when we finally arrived in our room we just wanted to take hot showers and get a good nights sleep having traveled all day across country. Unfortunately that was not to be because we first discovered that our bed was not very clean, we found some stains and hairs on the sheets so we asked to have them changed. A bellboy arrived shortly thereafter with a new set of sheets but he told us that there is not a housekeeping staff onsite in the evenings so we had to help him make the bed. After getting the issue resolved, we finally attempted to take hot showers but to our dismay there was only luke warm water, the water pressure was very low and we also discovered that the toilet wouldn’t flush! At this point we were so exhausted that we just decided to deal with the issues for the night so we could get to bed. The next morning we reported the issues to the front desk but on our second night both issues had not been resolved. To make matters worse, on our second night the people staying above us were extremely loud until about 3:30 AM and since the walls are so thin we could hear everything that was going on. We had finally had enough so on our 3rd morning we discussed the issues with the hotel manager and he was able to move us to another room on the 3rd floor. I will say that in our 2nd room the toilet worked fine, there was hot water and it was much quieter. Both rooms that we stayed in were not well lit and got almost no natural sunlight since they were opposite Ventura Blvd. Another thing that I found to be awkward was that the entranceway to the lobby is located in an unmarked side door off of Ventura Blvd. The door was kept ajar the entire time that we were there and I felt like anyone could walk in and hop on the elevator. There is no security that I could see so the fact that the door was open the entire time and people hanging out in the parking lot was concerning but that was just one of the many issues that I've already mentioned. Overall, I’ve had many enjoyable stays at numerous boutique hotels but this was by far my worst experience so I would not consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: jen_bump
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was an extremely positive experience! Every staff member I dealt with was very courteous and treated each request with a level of personal importance that has become harder and harder to find these days. The room was beautiful and very clean! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel! Thank you to everyone at The BLVD!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with loving personnel”
Reviews.Author: Sulma13
Reviews.Content: I was just their last week and I loved the hotel they have caring and helpful personnel who know the city very well and can give you exact location of were ever you need to go the bar is very nice and everyone in front desk are very polite and the housekeepers are nice and friendly and if you need anything they get right to it

Reviews.Title: “THEY LIED, I GOT DUPED”
Reviews.Author: JoJoStateWorker
Reviews.Content: Their website is flashy and we found out misleading. The price was amazing so I went for it. When we got there, wow I wanted to run. Its a refurbished Holiday Inn Express. Their website said: Discount tickets available for Universal Studios. LIE! I called downstairs and they said we "dont do that". --- BLVD guests will also enjoy a complimentary shuttle to Universal Studios. Half truth! Sure if we walk to Universal and catch the shuttle that is OFFERED TO ANYONE NOT JUST BLVD GUESTS!! Nice bait and switch, especially for someone who has a back problem and chose your hotel for the tickets and shuttle. I asked for the shuttle and was told to walk down the hill. BLVD Highlights: - Newly Built Luxuriously Furnished Hotel refurbished Holiday Inn Express - Free WiFi Would be nice if you advised your customers that they have to use a key to get into your net - Cafe Blvd a few SNapples , muffins and a box of Fruit Loops? - Indoor Heated Pool not open! Who wouldnt want to swim while on vacation? - 24 Hour Fitness Center where? Was it open? - 24 Hour Guest Service/Concierge Wasnt even asked how my stay was, was given a # to a cab instead of having one called for me - 24 Hour Security/Video Surveillance YOU NEED IT IN THAT NEIGHBORHOOD - Tour Deck/Car Rental no such thing - Valet Parking luckily we didnt need it Having booked online I never even knew of what was NOT available at the time of my stay. When I got there I felt trapped because all other rooms were skyrocketing due to Spring Break. Trust me I tried to find another room. Our room had scuffs on the baseboards, the coffee pot was dirty, there was a wire hanging out of the wall....yuck. I understand that bleaching towels is imparative but consider lowering it because I broke out all over due to the amount of it. I understand a soft opening of a hotel but to pull a bait and switch online is outrageous.

HotelInfo.Name: The BLVD Hotel & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 10730 Ventura Blvd, Studio City, Los Angeles, CA 91604
